items.title: 'Tip of the iceberg': Australia faces a rising threat
items.summary: In a more polarised world, political threats and violence are on the rise — and Australia is not immune.

items.title: Larrakia Elder arrested amid protests over controversial NT Administrator swearing-in
items.summary: Larrakia man Eric Fejo has been arrested at a protest opposing the swearing-in of NT Administrator David Connolly, following months of controversy around his selection for the role.

items.title: 'Significant progress' made during US and Iran talks — but no sign of a deal yet
items.summary: The discussions about the decades-long dispute over Iran's nuclear work come amid growing tension in the Middle East.

items.title: Sussan Ley won't return to parliament for farewell but is 'proud' of leadership milestone
items.summary: Becoming the first woman to lead any federal Opposition in Australia was "a milestone for all women to be proud of", Ley said.

items.title: I run a gay sauna in Australia. You'd be surprised who comes through the door
items.summary: Once stigmatised — and illegal — gay saunas like the one Glenn McNamara runs hold a special place in LGBTQI+ history.

items.title: Magda Szubanski says she's in remission after completing chemotherapy for cancer
items.summary: The comedian said she was "eternally grateful" to her medical team and those who've wished her well over the past nine months.

items.title: Clinton says she doesn't recall ever meeting Epstein, has no information about his crimes
items.summary: "I do not recall ever encountering Mr Epstein ... I have nothing to add to that," the former first lady said.

items.title: Last-minute apology for 'racist' posts 'doesn't change anything' for NT administrator, Elder says
items.summary: The incoming administrator's apology for widely criticised social media posts has not been accepted by some of his critics.

items.title: Your guide to the Women's Asian Cup 2026, as the Matildas chase redemption
items.summary: The Matildas will be hoping for a better result at the home tournament, after a shock early exit last time around.

items.title: Dateline returns with stories of the people caught in Trump's immigration crackdown
items.summary: Dateline's new season sees reporter Darren Mara meet ordinary Minnesotans who've found themselves at the heart of US President Donald Trump's crackdown on immigration.

items.title: How the US created a vacuum for the IS-linked cohort trying to return to Australia
items.summary: The US is halting support of two IS-linked camps in Syria, saying their help "cannot last forever".

items.title: The Chinese dance group at the centre of the Albanese bomb threat — and its link to Trump
items.summary: A threat that forced the prime minister to temporarily evacuate his official residence was directed at the Shen Yun company.

items.title: A global spectacle, a local crisis: Cartel violence and Mexico's World Cup moment
items.summary: Cartel violence has swept through parts of Mexico in recent days, raising questions over the country's ability to host football's biggest tournament.

items.title: Teenager confirmed as first Australian to have died from tick-induced red meat allergy
items.summary: A coroner has found that an Australian teenager's death in 2022 was the result of a rare condition called mammalian meat allergy.

items.title: Albanese addresses 'difficult' Grace Tame comment as Tame compares him to Morrison
items.summary: The prime minister said his comments were misrepresented following criticism on social media.

items.title: Want your property 'pinch me' moment? Here's how long it will take
items.summary: The time it takes to save a deposit to buy a home has blown out, according to a new report.

items.title: Two patients have died after a fungal outbreak at Sydney hospital
items.summary: The outbreak occurred between October and December 2025, and the hospital is currently under redevelopment.

items.title: 'Never hurt a fly': Chris Baghsarian's family pay tribute as accused killers face court
items.summary: The 85-year-old went missing from his Sydney home nearly two weeks ago, in what police believe was a mistaken identity kidnapping.

items.title: South African men allegedly lured to fight for Russia in Ukraine return home
items.summary: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa thanked his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, for helping to secure the group's return.

items.title: Australian diplomats' families in Middle East told to leave as US-Iran tensions rise
items.summary: DFAT said it had updated its advice in response to the "deteriorating security situation in the Middle East".

items.title: Syrian Kurdish official fears IS-linked cohort will 'become radicals' if not taken in
items.summary: An official overseeing a Syrian detention camp says Australia must take responsibility for the 34 women and children living there.

items.title: Israel responsible for two-thirds of record 129 journalist deaths in 2025, watchdog finds
items.summary: Most journalist deaths last year were from armed conflict, making it the second consecutive record-breaking year for fatalities.

items.title: China responds after banned dance troupe linked to threat that forced PM's evacuation
items.summary: The threat referenced Shen Yun — a cultural show linked to the spiritual movement Falun Gong, both of which have been banned by China.

items.title: From immigration to Iran: The key moments from Trump's State of the Union address
items.summary: The US president has delivered his annual national update, using the opportunity to burnish his achievements during a difficult period.
